snippet: State unemployment claims data, released by the Labor Department on Thursday, may take some of the edge off a report last week that showed job creation slowed sharply in May.
abstract: Labor Department reports initial claims for state unemployment benefits fell by 12,000 in the previous week to a seasonally adjusted 377,000; data may take some of the edge off a report showing that job creation slowed sharply in May.
lead_paragraph: State unemployment claims data, released by the Labor Department on Thursday, may take some of the edge off a report last week that showed job creation slowed sharply in May.

headline.seo: Data Hints Hiring Slowdown May Be Short-Lived
headline.main: New Jobless Data Hints at Short Hiring Slump
headline.print_headline: New Jobless Data Hints At Short Hiring Slump
